intro: Dichoropetalum alpinum, commonly known as the alpine dichoropetalum, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and other mountainous areas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a hardy species adapted to cold climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant in alpine ecosystems.
